content:
GeneralTransformCollection Class

In this Article

Represents an ordered collection of GeneralTransform objects.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class GeneralTransformCollection : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable, System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransform>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransform>, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransform>, System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • DependencyObject
  • Freezable
  • System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable
  • GeneralTransformCollection

Remarks

Except as noted, members of this class behave exactly as described by the IList<T>, ICollection<T>, and IEnumerable<T> documentation.

Freezable Features: Because it inherits from the Freezable class, the GeneralTransformCollection class provides several special features: GeneralTransformCollection objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe. For more information about the different features provided by Freezable objects, see the Freezable Objects Overview.

XAML Implicit Collection Usage

<object>  
  <object.property>  
    oneOrMoreGeneralTransformObjectElements  
  </object.property>  
</object>

XAML Values

oneOrMoreGeneralTransformObjectElements
One or more GeneralTransform objects, declared using object element syntax.

Constructors summary

GeneralTransformCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the GeneralTransformCollection class.
GeneralTransformCollection(IEnumerable<GeneralTransform>)

Initializes a new instance of the GeneralTransformCollection class.
GeneralTransformCollection(Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the GeneralTransformCollection class with the specified capacity, or the number of GeneralTransform objects the collection is initially capable of storing.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of GeneralTransform objects in the GeneralTransformCollection.
Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the GeneralTransform object at the specified index position.

Methods summary

Add(GeneralTransform)

Adds a GeneralTransform object to the end of the GeneralTransformCollection.
Clear()

Removes all GeneralTransform objects from the GeneralTransformCollection.
Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this GeneralTransformCollection, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
CloneCore(Freezable)
CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this GeneralTransformCollection object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
CloneCurrentValueCore(Freezable)
Contains(GeneralTransform)

Indicates whether the GeneralTransformCollection contains the specified GeneralTransform object.
CopyTo(GeneralTransform[],Int32)

Copies the GeneralTransform objects in the collection into an array of GeneralTransforms, starting at the specified index position.

FreezeCore(Boolean)
GetAsFrozenCore(Freezable)
GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore(Freezable)
GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the collection.
IndexOf(GeneralTransform)

Searches for the specified GeneralTransform object within a GeneralTransformCollection.
Insert(Int32,GeneralTransform)

Inserts a GeneralTransform object into the specified index position within the GeneralTransformCollection.
Remove(GeneralTransform)

Deletes a GeneralTransform object from the GeneralTransformCollection.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Deletes a GeneralTransform object from the GeneralTransformCollection.

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets or sets the GeneralTransform object at the specified index position.

    public System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransform this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index position of the object to get or set.

    • GeneralTransform

      The GeneralTransform object at the index position.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      value is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is not a valid index in the GeneralTransformCollection.

    • NotSupportedException

      The GeneralTransformCollection is read-only.

      - or -

      The GeneralTransformCollection has a fixed size.

    Remarks

    Unlike typical implementations of Item, this implementation throws an ArgumentException if you attempt to insert a null (Nothing) reference.

  • Clone()

    Creates a modifiable clone of this GeneralTransformCollection, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

    public System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransformCollection Clone ();

    Returns

    • GeneralTransformCollection

      A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

    Remarks

    This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

    For more information, see Clone.
